verses.kjv: All the commandments which I command thee this day shall ye observe to do, that ye may live, and multiply, and go in and possess the land which the LORD sware unto your fathers.
verses.web: You shall observe to do all the commandments which I command you today, that you may live, and multiply, and go in and possess the land which LORD swore to your fathers.
verses.ct: Be careful to follow every commandment I'm giving you today, so that you will live, grow in number, and enter and take possession of the land the LORD promised to your ancestors.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt remember all the way which the LORD thy God led thee these forty years in the wilderness, to humble thee, and to prove thee, to know what was in thine heart, whether thou wouldest keep his commandments, or no.
verses.web: You shall remember all the way which LORD your God has led you these forty years in the wilderness, that he might humble you, to test you, to know what was in your heart, whether you would keep his commandments or not.
verses.ct: Remember the entire journey the LORD your God led you on through the wilderness for these 40 years. He did it to humble you and test you, to find out what was really in your heart — whether you would keep his commandments or not.

verses.kjv: And he humbled thee, and suffered thee to hunger, and fed thee with manna, which thou knewest not, neither did thy fathers know; that he might make thee know that man doth not live by bread only, but by every word that proceedeth out of the mouth of the LORD doth man live.
verses.web: He humbled you, allowed you to be hungry, and fed you with manna, which you didn’t know, neither did your fathers know, that he might teach you that man does not live by bread only, but man lives by every word that proceeds out of LORD’s mouth.
verses.ct: He humbled you and let you go hungry, then fed you with manna — something neither you nor your ancestors had ever seen before. He did this to teach you that people don't survive on bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth of the LORD.

verses.kjv: Thy raiment waxed not old upon thee, neither did thy foot swell, these forty years.
verses.web: Your clothing didn’t grow old on you, neither did your foot swell, these forty years.
verses.ct: Your clothes never wore out, and your feet never swelled during all those 40 years.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt also consider in thine heart, that, as a man chasteneth his son, so the LORD thy God chasteneth thee.
verses.web: You shall consider in your heart that as a man disciplines his son, so LORD your God disciplines you.
verses.ct: Think about this carefully: just as a father disciplines his son, the LORD your God disciplines you.

verses.kjv: Therefore thou shalt keep the commandments of the LORD thy God, to walk in his ways, and to fear him.
verses.web: You shall keep the commandments of LORD your God, to walk in his ways, and to fear him.
verses.ct: So keep the commandments of the LORD your God — live the way he wants you to live, and fear him.

verses.kjv: For the LORD thy God bringeth thee into a good land, a land of brooks of water, of fountains and depths that spring out of valleys and hills;
verses.web: For LORD your God brings you into a good land, a land of brooks of water, of springs, and underground water flowing into valleys and hills;
verses.ct: The LORD your God is bringing you into a wonderful land — a land with flowing streams, springs, and underground waters that rise up in the valleys and hills;

verses.kjv: A land of wheat, and barley, and vines, and fig trees, and pomegranates; a land of oil olive, and honey;
verses.web: a land of wheat, barley, vines, fig trees, and pomegranates; a land of olive trees and honey;
verses.ct: a land rich with wheat, barley, grapevines, fig trees, and pomegranates; a land of olive trees and honey;

verses.kjv: A land wherein thou shalt eat bread without scarceness, thou shalt not lack any thing in it; a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose hills thou mayest dig brass.
verses.web: a land in which you shall eat bread without scarcity, you shall not lack anything in it; a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose hills you may dig copper.
verses.ct: a land where you'll never go hungry or lack anything. Its rocks contain iron, and you can dig copper from its hills.

verses.kjv: When thou hast eaten and art full, then thou shalt bless the LORD thy God for the good land which he hath given thee.
verses.web: You shall eat and be full, and you shall bless LORD your God for the good land which he has given you.
verses.ct: When you've eaten your fill, praise the LORD your God for the good land he has given you.

verses.kjv: Beware that thou forget not the LORD thy God, in not keeping his commandments, and his judgments, and his statutes, which I command thee this day:
verses.web: Beware lest you forget LORD your God, in not keeping his commandments, his ordinances, and his statutes, which I command you today;
verses.ct: But be careful that you don't forget the LORD your God by failing to keep his commandments, his laws, and his statutes that I'm giving you today.

verses.kjv: Lest when thou hast eaten and art full, and hast built goodly houses, and dwelt therein;
verses.web: lest, when you have eaten and are full, and have built fine houses and lived in them;
verses.ct: When you've eaten your fill and built beautiful homes to live in,

verses.kjv: And when thy herds and thy flocks multiply, and thy silver and thy gold is multiplied, and all that thou hast is multiplied;
verses.web: and when your herds and your flocks multiply, and your silver and your gold is multiplied, and all that you have is multiplied;
verses.ct: and your herds and flocks have grown large, and your silver and gold have piled up, and everything you own has increased —

verses.kjv: Then thine heart be lifted up, and thou forget the LORD thy God, which brought thee forth out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage;
verses.web: then your heart might be lifted up, and you forget LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage;
verses.ct: don't let your heart swell with pride and forget the LORD your God, who brought you out of Egypt, out of slavery;

verses.kjv: Who led thee through that great and terrible wilderness, wherein were fiery serpents, and scorpions, and drought, where there was no water; who brought thee forth water out of the rock of flint;
verses.web: who led you through the great and terrible wilderness, with venomous snakes and scorpions, and thirsty ground where there was no water; who poured water for you out of the rock of flint;
verses.ct: who led you through that vast and terrifying wilderness filled with venomous snakes and scorpions, through parched land where there was no water at all; who made water pour out of solid rock for you;

verses.kjv: Who fed thee in the wilderness with manna, which thy fathers knew not, that he might humble thee, and that he might prove thee, to do thee good at thy latter end;
verses.web: who fed you in the wilderness with manna, which your fathers didn’t know, that he might humble you, and that he might prove you, to do you good at your latter end;
verses.ct: who fed you in the wilderness with manna, something your ancestors had never known. He did all this to humble you and test you, so that in the end it would go well for you.

verses.kjv: And thou say in thine heart, My power and the might of mine hand hath gotten me this wealth.
verses.web: and lest you say in your heart, “My power and the might of my hand has gotten me this wealth.”
verses.ct: Don't ever say to yourself, 'I earned all this wealth by my own strength and effort.'

verses.kjv: But thou shalt remember the LORD thy God: for it is he that giveth thee power to get wealth, that he may establish his covenant which he sware unto thy fathers, as it is this day.
verses.web: But you shall remember LORD your God, for it is he who gives you power to get wealth, that he may establish his covenant which he swore to your fathers, as it is today.
verses.ct: Instead, remember the LORD your God, because he is the one who gives you the ability to produce wealth. He does this to fulfill the covenant he swore to your ancestors, just as he is doing today.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, if thou do at all forget the LORD thy God, and walk after other gods, and serve them, and worship them, I testify against you this day that ye shall surely perish.
verses.web: It shall be, if you shall forget LORD your God, and walk after other gods, and serve them and worship them, I testify against you today that you shall surely perish.
verses.ct: But I'm warning you right now: if you ever forget the LORD your God and chase after other gods, serving and worshiping them, you will certainly be destroyed.

verses.kjv: As the nations which the LORD destroyeth before your face, so shall ye perish; because ye would not be obedient unto the voice of the LORD your God.
verses.web: As the nations that LORD makes to perish before you, so you shall perish, because you wouldn’t listen to LORD your God’s voice.
verses.ct: Just like the nations the LORD is wiping out ahead of you, you too will perish — because you refused to listen to the LORD your God.
